Select the Second Piece to Swap
Like Regular Tic-Tac-Toe, Players must connect all of their pieces (X or O) either

But instead of just placing your piece on the grid, players now have the option to perform other moves (click on moves on the bottom bar to find out more info about moves)/nEach move contains a number next to it, which indicates the cost in order to perform that move./nEach player at the beginning of the game starts out with 2 points (see "How to Gain Points" to learn how to gain points in the game).
Place: allows players to place a piece on the grid. /nInitial cost: Free!
Delete: allows players to delete the opponents piece on the grid. /nInitial Cost: 2 points /nCost Increase per Use: +1
Swap: allows players to swap between two positions on the grid. /nInitial Cost: 3 points /nCost Increase per Use: +2

Extra Turn: allows players to gain an extra turn to perform another move. Note: this can only be used once per turn, and the player has to already use it\'s turn prior in order to perform this move. /nInitial Cost: 5 points /nCost Increase per Use: +3
In order to gain points, players must place their game pieces adjacent to each other (Note: pieces can only be adjacent to one other piece, examples shown below).
When the player decides to end their turn, the "End Turn" button displays a number next to it, which shows the number of points that player will gain from that turn.
In regular Tic-Tac-Toe, the grid size is always 3x3. In this game however, players now have the option to increase the grid to 5x5 and 7x7.
In order to increase the grid size, the number of turns displaying in the button "Increase Size" must be 0, which happens when a player ends their turn, decreasing that number by one.
